action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow in the refrigerator, the book in the wardrobe and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a table, a chair, a side table and a couch. There is a passage to a hallway here.
> take pillow
Turn 1
You can't see a pillow here.
> search living room
Turn 2
Livingroom is not an entity. (this should not occur.)
> search table
Turn 3
There is nothing on the table.
> go to hallway
Turn 4
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet, a kitchen and a living room here.
> go to kitchen
Turn 5
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a hallway here.
> open cupboard
Turn 6
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there are a plate and a book.
> take plate
Turn 7
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
> go to hallway
Turn 8
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet, a kitchen and a living room here.
> go to bedroom
Turn 9
You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed and a wardrobe. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
> open wardrobe
Turn 10
The wardrobe is now open. In the wardrobe there is a pillow.
> take pillow
Turn 11
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a plate and a pillow.

> go to kitchen


> put plate on counter
